str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Optative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
Pity, mercy, compassion. Of uncertain affinity; compassion.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
From a derivative of oninemi and phoros; profit-bearer; Onesiphorus, a Christian.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To refresh, revive, comfort. From ana and psucho; properly, to cool off, i.e. relieve.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be ashamed, be ashamed of. From epi and aischunomai; to feel shame for something.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A (light) chain, bond. Of uncertain derivation; a fetter or manacle.
